IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Provides spiritual, health and youth development programs to Maine coastal and island communities
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Maine Sea Coast Mission provides spiritual, health, and youth development programs in coastal and island communities from Mid-Coast to Downeast Maine. Rooted in a history of non-denominational service, the Mission offers hope, encouragement, and help to strengthen individuals, families and communities.
IRS990.Description: The "EDGE" after school program - children in grades four through twelve are helped to gain the skills they need to succeed as students and to build their character and confidence through multi-site in school, after school and summer programs called "The EDGE." The goal is youth development and family support. Approximately 590 students participate annually.

Activity2.Description: Outer Island Pastor & Community Support - Pastoral counseling, worship, art instruction, recreation, health services, community support and fellowship are provided to the residents of offshore islands of Downeast Maine. These services are made possible by a minister and other staff on the Mission's boat, Sunbeam V, that visits 10 isolated coastal islands throughout the year, in all weather conditions. This program serves approximately 8,800 people each year. Health services includes telemedicine - an array of preventive and acute health care services provided to the residents of the outer islands by a mission nurse working in collaboration with physicians on the mainland. The link between the patients and nurse on board the Subeam V and the physicians on the mainland is through a variety of highly technical equipment that is collectively referred to as "Telemedicine." Islanders can consult with their primary care practitioners or obtain specialty care through this service.

Activity3.Description: Downeast Campus Community Outreach - People in need in Downeast Maine receive a variety of services operating out of the Downeast campus in Cherryfield, Maine. Clothing vouchers are provided to adults who need clothing for work and to children who need clothing for school. The food pantry provides approximately 83,883 meals annually. The campus also provides a senior companion program in Washington and Hancock counties and hosts church groups participating in the summer housing rebuild and weatherization program. The campus serves approximately 7,550 individuals every year in a geographic area occupied by 34,000 people.

ActivityOther.Description: Colket Center Community Outreach - The Colket Center serves as the site for memorial services and weddings. Community non-profit groups throughout Downeast Maine use the Colket Center for meetings and classes.

Christmas Program - Approximately 3,000 needy children, families and elderly individuals on the islands and in coastal communities of Hancock and Washington counties receive new, donated gifts that have been wrapped by volunteers. The Mission distributes nearly 18,000 gifts each Christmas season.
Scholarship Program - Grants are provided to individuals from island and coastal communities to enable them to attend college.

Swan's Island Food Pantry - Financial support for the food purchases in our Bread of Life Food Pantry on Swan's Island. The expenses are purchases of food stock inventory. The Bread of Life Food Pantry supports individuals and families on the Island that experience food insecurity.

Emergency Financial Assistance - Financial aid is provided for heating assistance for individuals and families in Hancock and Washington counties who have urgent needs that cannot be met by other sources.

Form990PartVIISectionA.NamePerson: The Rt Rev J Clark Grew
Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: Director

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Income in permanently restricted funds may be used for the specified programs. Income and principal in temporarily restricted funds will be used as needed for the specified programs. The financial statements were restated for 2009 and as a result the endowment fund was adjusted. The totals for 2008 are not available.
Beneficial Interest in Perpetual Trusts not reported in prior year 3,712,452.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The Mission utilizes a committee to review, award, and celebrate scholarship award candidates. Expected Family Contribution (EFC) as reported in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) application process is one of several variables considered for candidates from the Mission's geographic footprint. The committee includes staff and Mission board members.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: Brokerage firm engaged to sell gifts of securities. Marine sales agent engaged to sell contributed boat.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The completed Form 990 is reviewed by the Finance Director and the Executive Director. It is then given to the Treasurer who meets with the Finance Committee to review the 990. After the Committee approves the 990, it is then brought before the Board for a final approval.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The policy is self-policing at the board level. Members recuse themselves from discussions and voting whenever they have a conflict of interest regarding the issue on the floor.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Maine Sea Coast Mission reviews market rates through various media including, but not limited to, the internet, newspapers, and professional subscription services to set and maintain its wage and salary rates at competitive, yet sustainable levels.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public through its website www.seacoastmission.org.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Net unrealized gains on investments: 2,769,430. Beneficial Interest in Perpetual Trusts not reported in prior year 3,712,452. Total to Form 990, Part XI, Line 5: 6,481,882.
The audit process has not changed from the prior year.
